title: Man gets hit by door, gets $21.5m in damages from Holland America | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news tanveer mann for metro.co.uk

text:
Tanveer Mann for Metro.co.uk Friday 13 Nov 2015 10:20 am James Hausman as the door closed 
A man has been awarded a staggering £14.1 million in damages after he was hit by a door which left him with minor seizures. 
James Hausman was struck in the head by a door while he was travelling aboard a Holland America cruise ship in 2011. 
He suffered a minor brain injury and was left prone to vertigo and small seizures. James Hausman is hit in head by glass door on cruise ship 
This week, Hausman was awarded $21.5 million in damages by a U.S. District Court jury in Seattle, which is reportedly one of the largest verdicts issued by a Washington State federal court. 
According to his attorneys, Hausman, who owns a precious-metals shop in Springfield, Illinois, was able to finish his 280-day world cruise following the incident but he suffered several seizures after that. 
Holland America claimed Hausmen carelessly walked into the door and called the incident ‘anomalous’. 
But Hausman’s attorney Rick Friedman brought up 16 other incidents where passengers were hit by a sliding glass door. 
Friedman said the door’s motion sensors were scheduled to open and close much faster than usual, claiming the cruise ship were worried more about air-conditioning costs than the safety of their passengers. 
Holland America has filed an appeal.
